article.title: Unveiling the Role of the Magnetic Field at the Smallest Scales of Star Formation

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays multi-scale observations of the protostellar source Ser-emb 8. What does the grayscale represent in all three panels?
choices: Magnetic field strength
Polarization fraction
Total intensity (Stokes I) thermal dust emission
Velocity of the driven turbulent motions

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 1, line segments represent the magnetic field orientation. How is this orientation derived from the observed data?
choices: Rotated by 90° from the dust polarization
Aligned with the direction of the bipolar outflow
Directly measured from Zeeman splitting of spectral lines
Calculated from the gradient of the total intensity

multiple_choice_question.text: Panel (c) showcases the highest resolution observation of Ser-emb 8, achieved with ALMA. What important feature, predicted by strong-field star formation models, is NOT observed in this panel?
choices: A clear bipolar outflow
Filamentary structure perpendicular to the magnetic field
A centrally peaked intensity profile
An hourglass morphology in the magnetic field

multiple_choice_question.text: The black ellipses in the lower-left corners of panels (b) and (c) represent the synthesized beams. What do these beams signify in the context of the observations?
choices: The physical size of the telescope dishes used for the observation
The strength of the magnetic field at the observed location
The resolution elements, indicating the smallest resolvable structures
The uncertainties associated with the measured polarization angles

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure presents multi-scale projections of simulated data from the AREPO code. What physical parameter is being varied across the four columns?
choices: Sonic Mach number (Ms)
Initial mean magnetic field strength (Bmean-field)
Virial parameter (avir)
Sound speed (cs)

multiple_choice_question.text: What prominent morphological difference is evident between the strong-field (rightmost column) and weak-field simulations in the bottom row, showcasing the protostar scale?
choices: Presence of bipolar outflows in the strong-field case
Higher degree of fragmentation in the weak-field cases
Obvious filamentary structure aligned perpendicular to the magnetic field in the strong-field case
Larger protostellar core size in the weak-field cases

multiple_choice_question.text: The middle row displays a zoom-in between JCMT and CARMA scales. What do the simulations reveal about the fragmentation of the collapsing core as the magnetic field strength increases?
choices: Fragmentation is enhanced in stronger magnetic fields
Fragmentation is suppressed in stronger magnetic fields
Magnetic field strength has no discernible impact on fragmentation
Fragmentation is only affected by the sonic Mach number

multiple_choice_question.text: The top row depicts the full-scale AREPO simulations, representing a 5.2 pc region. What initial condition is consistent across all four simulations, representing a typical characteristic of giant molecular clouds (GMCs)?
choices: Super-Alfvénic turbulence
Sub-Alfvénic turbulence
Virial parameter (avir) of 0.1
Virial parameter (avir) of 1

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure presents the Histogram of Relative Orientation (HRO) analysis. What information does the HRO convey about the relationship between the magnetic field and density structures?
choices: The absolute strength of the magnetic field
The relative alignment between the magnetic field orientation and density gradients
The velocity dispersion of the turbulent motions
The degree of polarization fraction

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the HRO, what does a peak at Φ = 0°  signify?
choices: Random alignment between the magnetic field and density structures
Magnetic field preferentially perpendicular to the filamentary density structures
Magnetic field preferentially parallel to the filamentary density structures
No correlation between magnetic field and density structures

multiple_choice_question.text: The HRO of the strongly magnetized simulation (B = 120 µG)  exhibits a distinct peak.  What does this peak suggest about the role of the magnetic field in shaping the protostellar core?
choices: The magnetic field is turbulent and does not influence the core structure
The magnetic field is dynamically important in shaping the core structure
The magnetic field is solely determined by the initial conditions
The magnetic field is only affected by the outflow feedback

multiple_choice_question.text: The HRO of the Ser-emb 8 ALMA data appears relatively flat. Which simulated scenario most closely resembles the observed HRO of Ser-emb 8?
choices: The strongly magnetized simulation (B = 120 µG)
The weakly magnetized simulations (B = 1.2, 12, and 36 µG)
None of the simulated scenarios accurately represent the observed data
Further observations are needed to make a definitive conclusion
